Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Rev. Jason P. Radmacher, Pastor, John Street United Methodist Church, 44 John Street, New York, NY 10038

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Gerson.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rev. Jason P. Radmacher, Pastor, John Street United Methodist Church, 44 John Street, New York, N.Y. 10038.

Council Member Gerson moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Page Ayres Cowley to the Council for its advice and consent regarding her appointment to the Landmarks Preservation Commission, Pursuant to Sections 31 and 3020 of the City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Page Ayres Cowley, Landmarks Preservation Commission

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. C 070411 ZSM, shall be subject to Council review.  This application is related to application no. C 000198 ZMM that is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, 1113 York Avenue, Manhattan (C070441ZSM)

Discussion of General Orders

Reports of Standing Committees

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the composition of the fire department pension fund medical board.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to adopt S. 2644 and A. 5178, legislation which would make certain persons who are eligible for or receiving social security disability insurance (SSDI) benefits eligible for the Elderly Pharmaceutical Insurance Coverage (EPIC) program.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse and Disability Services
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Make certain persons who are eligible for or receiving social security disability insurance (SSDI) benefits eligible for Elderly Pharmaceutical Insurance Coverage (EPIC) program. (S.2644 and A.5178)

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutons
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution denouncing foreclosures precipitated by subprime and predatory lending, and supporting state and federal legislation that regulates lenders and assists borrowers engaged in subprime mortgages.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Denouncing foreclosures precipitated by subprime and predatory lending, and supporting state and federal legislation that regulates lenders and assists borrowers engaged in subprime mortgages.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to strengthen vehicle window tinting laws and urging the federal government to consider revising federal law in this area to enhance the safety of police officers.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Strengthen vehicle window tinting laws.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to create a low-cost health insurance program for young adults.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Create a low-cost health insurance program for young adults.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to harassment.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: In relation to harassment.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the review of curb cuts.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Review of curb cuts.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the boards of New York City and New York State’s pension funds to support the goals of Burma’s democracy movement by introducing shareholder resolutions to pressure companies to suspend operations in Burma.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Pension funds to support the goals of Burma’s democracy movement by introducing shareholder resolutions to pressure companies to suspend operations in Burma.

Items.Title: Resolution commending the Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture for its efforts in preserving materials documenting the experiences of people of African descent throughout the world and urging the New York Public Library to maintain the Schomburg Center as one of the preeminent research libraries in the City of New York.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Commending the Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass as the “Bridging the Gap for Wounded Warriors Act”.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Veterans
Items.MatterName: Congress to pass as the “Bridging the Gap for Wounded Warriors Act”.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring a recycling program for plastic carryout bags and film plastic.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Requiring a recycling program for plastic carryout bags.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to adopt and the Governor to sign legislation which would allow credit unions, savings banks, savings and loan associations and federal savings associations to accept and secure deposits from municipal corporations.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Allow credit unions, savings banks, savings and loan associations and federal savings associations to accept and secure deposits from municipal corporations.
